org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt

Class FairSimulation.CompoundState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AutomatonComponent
        • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.GraphicComponent
          • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.State
            • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.game.GameState
              • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.FairSimulation.CompoundState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
    Enclosing class:
    FairSimulation

    public static class FairSimulation.CompoundState
extends GameState
    This class provides the compound state (s1, s2, a) owned by GamePlayer#P0 or (s1, s2) owned by GamePlayer#P1 where s1 is a state from an automaton A1, s2 is a state from an automaton A2, and a is a symbol in the alphabet. The objective is to test if A1 is simulated by A2. If the automata have labels on states, then the symbol should be null.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                     State s1,

        Constructs this compound state owned by GamePlayer.P0.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID of the state
        s1 - the first state in this compound state
        s2 - the second state in this compound state
        symbol - a symbol in the alphabet, or null if the automata have labels on states

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.String getSymbol()
        Returns the symbol in this compound state. If this state is owned by GamePlayer.P1 or the automata have labels on states, the returned symbol will be null.
        Returns:
        the symbol in this compound state, or null if this state is owned by GamePlayer.P1 or the automata have labels on states
